titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: V:30. With Mr Boylston to Worcester— At Governor Lincoln’s— Mr Boylston returned Princeton— Dined with Govr. Lincoln—Mrs Lincoln—Mrs Sever, daughter to Mr Trask Judges Parker, Pitman, Wilde and Morton—Company of 25—J. Welles of Boston— Society of Odd fellows— Dr Mitchells symbols, Jews harp— Barton’s oration— J. C. Symmes honorary member— Supper— W. Lincoln’s poem— Lodge at the Governor’s

Ploughing Match at 9. Ploughs with one yoke and ploughman and with two yokes and another With and without wheels— To the Governor’s—procession to the Meeting house— Address of Governor Lincoln as President of the Agricultural Society— Announced me and the judges of S.C. Sir Isaac Coffin and as honorary members— Nelson’s prayer— Washburn’s Oration— Back to the Governor’s— Visited the Penns—Oxen, Bulls—Cows,—Calves, Swine, Merino Sheep and Horses— Cart loaded with stones driven uphill— Collation at Mr Bigelow’s Procession to dinner at the Town-Hall— Toasts— Visit to the Manufacturer— Reports of the Committees adjudging premiums— Tea at the Governor’s— Oratorio—Handel—Star of Bethlehem Miss Kimberley— Ball, which I did not attend—

Left Governor Lincolns at 7— Breakfasted at Baker’s, Grafton— Met Thomas Dexter, and his wife, daughter of T. C. Amory— Manufactory of duck at Grafton— Dined at Slatersville Anderson—Buildings burnt— Visited the Spindles 300— Reached Providence at Sunset— W and Mrs Payne— Letters to Govr Lincoln, and John Binns.
The President of the United States
